column61: The Information In Room Suggests Arriving 45 Minutes Prior To A Treatment. I Arrived 30 Minutes Early (As Had Not Long Arrived In The Hotel  So Would Have Struggled To Make 45 Minutes. The Medical Disclaimer Form And Getting Changed Took All Of 5 Minutes  So Was Left With A Lot Of Time To Kill. Perhaps 45 Minutes Is A Bit Of An Overestimation.
column71: My Husband And I Booked The Upgrade Deal (Upgrade To The Next Available Room Type  2 Quarter Bottles Of Champagne  5 Course Tasting Menu Included). On Our Drive Down From Scotland (Which Was Supposed To Be Leisurely  With A Couple Of Stops To Break Things Up)  I Became Aware Of A Voice Mail Message On My Phone  From A Yorkshire Number  That I Was Unable To Access For An Hour Or So Due To A Lack Of Mobile Phone Reception. This Was Slightly Unsettling  As I Realised It Was From Your Hotel  And Was Unsure Whether There Was A Problem With The Room  Eg A Double Booking. When I Was Able To Access The Message  It Was To Inform Us That The Kitchen Was Out Of Use (Extractor Fans Not Working  Therefore Unable To Use The Gas) And That We Couldn't Have Dinner At The Restaurant. While It Was Great That Alternative Arrangements Had Been Made At The Black Swan  We Were Disappointed That Our Room Rate Was Only Reduced To Â£140 B+B  Whereas We Were Expecting To Pay Â£220 For Db+B - As The Tasting Menu Was Â£50 Pp At The Black Swan  Meaning The Price Of Our Night Away Jumped To Â£240. The Fact That A Tasting Menu Was Included In The Initial Deal Was The Main Reason We Booked  As We Enjoy Our Food  And The Experience Of A Tasting Menu. My Husband Did Raise This Issue With The Reception Staff On The Day Of Our Arrival  And After Some Discussion It Was Agreed That The B+B Rate Would Be Reduced To Â£120  After All  It Was Not Our Fault That We Were Not Being Propvided With What We Booked.  We Were Assured That There Would Be A Full Breakfast On In The Morning  Which We Were Dubious About As We Were Not Sure How Likely The Fans Would Have Been Fixed From The Previous Evening. The Waiting Staff Told Us That Instead Of Individually Prepared Breakfasts  A Cooked Buffet Had Been Organised. Not Quite The Same To Us  But Can't Fault The Helpfulness And Friendliness Of The Staff That Morning.   When We Came To Settle The Bill  We Were Very Disappointed To Find That The Rate Hadn't Been Discounted To Â£140 As Discussed And That We Had To Make Our Point Again.   All In All  A Lovely Hotel  But Wasn't Quite The Experience We Were Hoping For  I Think Coloured Slightly By The Phone Message On The Way Down  And Wondering What The Alternative Dining Experience Would Be Like. (Which Turned Out To Be Lovely  But We Had No Knowledge Of The Black Swan Prior To The Arrival).

column16: Other: Redeemed Voucher And Called Direct
column31: Service On Arrival Was Excellent. The General Knowledge / Training Level Of The Staff Was Sometimes Quite Poor  Although Always Polite.
column36: I Really Enjoyed My Stay And I Am Glad That We Upgraded To The Poolside Cottage. Although  I Must Say That The Rooms Are Starting To Fray Around The Edges  Especially The Carpets They Were Coming Up At The Edges And Were Not That Clean
column47: When Paying A Lot Of Money For A Dining Experience You Expect High Quality. The Food Did Not Disappoint But The Wine Pairings Did Not Arrive At The Same Time As The Food  We Had To Repeatedly Ask For Things. I Must Say That The Staff Were Polite  Disorganized And Sometimes Lacking Training.
column61: We Just Used The Spa Rooms  And They Were Fine
column70: It Is Bad To Say This But At Times I Feel That The Pool Area Would Benefit From Being Child Free. We Were On A Romantic Weekend  We Both Love Kids But It Does Change The Atmosphere

column31: All Was Excellent Apart From The Head Waiter Who Wore A Suit  Who We Found Very Unfriendly And Lacking In Basic Manners And Was The Sole Reason We Did Not Rate Overall Excellent. Maybe Hospitality Should Not Be His Profession.  The Other Waiting Staff Were Excellent. Even Though A Lot Of The 5 Course Taster Menu Was Not To My Partners Liking. I Think If We Returned We Would Order Off The A La Carte.   However We Came For My Partners Birthday Celebration  And Found All Other Aspects Of The Hotel And Spa To Be Absolutely Outstanding  Exceeding Other 5* Spas We Have Stayed At In London  Milan And New York. We Will Be Coming Again And Recommending To Our Friends
column47: Please See Previous Comments. In Numerous Occasions We Had To Ask More Than Twice To Get Drinks Taking 20Mins To Arrive At One Point   And The Head Waiter Left A Lot To Be Admired.
column65: I Think It Was Louise  However The Lady Who Dealt With My Reservation Was Exceptional In Helping Organise A Birthday Weekend For My Partner  And Helping Me Arrange Flowers To Be Delivered  Was Knowledgable Of The Area And Was Able To Make Recommendations On Local Sites To Visit And Spa Treatments To Choose. Louise Is A Credit To The Hotel And Spa.
column70: The Seasonal Taster Menu  Could Have Been Advertised More Clearly  This Would Have Allowed Us To Decide To Choose The A La Carte Which Was More To Our Liking And Would Have Improved Our Dining Experience.

column36: Booked A Spa Suite  It Faced The Car Park Wall  Very Poor For Â£420

column31: Staff Were Very Friendly And Professional
column36: Number 6. Was Very Disappointed With The Room To Be Honest. Was Very Tired And Rough Around The Edges - Eg Bath Very Tatty. There Was No Air Conditioning And Room Was Extremely Hot Due To Only Small Window. Internet Signal Was Also Very Poor. Booked In With Some Friends And Their Room Was Much Bigger And In A Better State Of Repair (Even Though We Booked Same Room Type)
column47: We Booked The Stay Basically To Dine And To Relax In The Hot Tub. We Were On Told Our Arrival That The Hot Tub Was Not Working But It Would Be Fixed Shortly (It Remained Out Of Order Throughout Our Stay) And Then To Make Matters Worse We Were Then Told In The Afternoon That We Could Not Dine In The Restaurant (We Had Pre-Booked) Because There Was An Issue With The Extractor Fan. Subsequently We Were Then Told That We Were To Dine In An Alternative Restaurant - The Black Old Swan At Oldstead - Where We Ended On An Hour Long Taxi Round Trip And Sat Downstairs Effectively In Dark Pub (Although The Food Was Very Good).
column61: Wanted To Purely Use The Hot Tub But Was Out Of Order All Weekend
column65: Staff Were Generally Excellent  Particularly The Gentlemen Who Greets You At Reception On Your Arrival. The Only Negative Aspect I Encountered Was At Breakfast. As The Four Of Us Was Served Our Cooked Breakfasts - I Noticed A Very Large Long Hair In Mine  Which I Pointed Out. The Waitress Then Took It Away And It Took A Full 20 Minutes To Bring Me A Replacement (And Without An Apology)  At Which Point My Fellow Guests Had Finished.
column70: To Be Fair The Staff Were Excellent But Frankly We Came Away For My Birthday To Relax And Eat At The Restaurant In Nice Surroundings - Unfortunately We Spent Nearly Â£1000 Between Us To Get A Sub-Standard Room  No Hot Tub Or Meal At The Restaurant.

column31: The Place Needs A Bit Of A Touch Up Here And There. Peeling Paint  Broken Lights  Badly Worn Carpets  Cobwebs In Corners - Not Really Up The Standard It Used To Be
column36: Colours Of Room Were Very Dark - Needed All The Lights On During The Day (I Know This Was Fashionable When The Hotel Was First Set Up - But Needs Repainting In Lighter Colours Now)  Bathroom -Products  Did Not Notice  Room Was Not Very Clean (Cobwebs In Corners) And Need Some Maintenance (Broken Light  Broken Shower  Loose Wc Seat)  Wireless Internet Did Not Reach To Our Suite At Far Side Of Pool
column47: The Food Was Good - Certainly - Although Good Rather Than Outstanding. However It Was Let Down By Poor Service  Specifically:    - Waiting In The Bar For An Hour Before Going Into Dinner (50 Minutes After Our Reservation Time)    - Left At Table With No Offer Of Water Or Bread Until First Course Arrived    - Had To Ask For The Bread Rolls Twice & By The Time It Came I Had Already Eaten My Soup  To Get A Michelin Star The Service Needs To Be As Good As The Food
column65: Breakfast Service Became A Bit Of A Running Joke Between Ourselves And Other Guests. The Table Would Not Be Set With The Appropriate Cutlery  Boiled Eggs Would Then Arrive Without A Spoon To Eat It With  The Toast Was Always Cold Yet Still Took Ages To Arrive  Bacon Would Be Undercooked One Day And Then Overcooked The Next   And Of Course Having To Wait In The Lounge For 20 Minutes Before A Table Is Made Ready Is Not Convenient In The Morning When One Has Plans For The Day
column70: Not That I Have Not Already Mentioned.  The Hotel Is In A Great Spot - And The Pool Really Makes The Hotel Stand Out - Its A Pretty And Relaxing Place To Spend Time It Could Be Outstanding But It Just Falls Down On A Few Key Basics  Specifically:  - Standard Of Maintenance -Fix The Broken Things  Paint The Peeling Things  Replace The Worn Out Things  - Standard Of Service - I Suspect Better Training Is Needed - Especially For The Youngsters - Do They Know The Standard That You Expect From Them?  - The Restaurant - The Pricing Sets Expectations Of Excellence Which Is Almost (But Not Entirely) Met By The Food But Not At All By The Rest Of The Experience
column71: We Did Overall Enjoy Our Stay - But Ive Tried To Be Constructive In This Feedback As I Presume You Want Honest Answers Of What Should Be Done To Improve.  Now - The Truth Is  I Suspect That You Have Some Financial Constraints That Are Preventing Some Of These Things Beings Addressed (Otherwise How Would You Not Have Noticed & Repaved The Stair Carpet!) - So Some Prioritisation Is Likely Called For  Hope That Helps !  A
column72: Honestly I Think You Have Other Things To Focus On First. I'd Check What Power Youre Consuming To Heat The Pool - And It Not Already The Case Id Consider A Heat Pump Or Solar System. The Problem Will Be The Initial Capital Outlay Thought.

column26: You Have My Letter  But Sent Me This Survey Instead Of Responding.
column72: No - You've Already Stopped Providing Towel. You've Gone Far Enough.

column47: There Was No Clean Table For Breakfast When We Arrived  Which Was Acceptable; But It Then Took 15 Minutes Before We Were Advised None Were Going To Be Ready And Could Sit In The Restaurant. Subsequent Service In The Restaurant Was Very Slow.   Service At Our Evening People Was Better  But Still Not Of A High Standard.

column36: The Bathroom Could Have Been Cleaner And Outside Area Needed A Good Clean Up
column47: This Was A Special Occasion For Me And My Husband And Was Very Dissapointing.  The Food And Service Was Very Poor.. We Had The Tasting Menu. There Was No Atmosphere At All In The Restaurant.  We Felt Like We Were In A Doctors Surgery.  If We Ever Come Back We Would Definitely Not Eat In Teh Restaurant.
column65: The Reception Staff Were Very Helpfull And Very Kind And Polite.  The Bar Staff Which We Ordered Drinks From In The Afternoon Could Not Be Bothered With Customers.  It Was A Very Warm Day And He Looked Like He Did Not Want To Be There.  In The Restaurant In The Evening The Service Was Not Too Bad  But Far From Excellent.
column71: This Hotel Is Lovely And We Would Love To Stay With You Again.  We Would Not Choose To Eat In The Restaurant For Our Evening Meal As We Feel The Food Was Awfull.  The Pool Area Was Lovely And The Weather Made It For Us.  All In All Though This Was Dissapointing For My Hubands Special Occasion

column22: A Bit Of A Breakdown In Communication Occurred Between Two Staff Members. Don't Feel That A Booking Should Depend On Speaking To The Same Individual On Each Occasion.
column31: Front Reception Impressive  Signs Of Wear And Tear Apparent In All Other Areas.
column36: Again  Room Looked Tired. Bathroom Shabby  Especially Near Bath Itself. Carpets Threadbare In Places. Scatter Cushions Looked Grubby. No Safe In Room Or Mini Bar/Fridge. Room Directory Torn And Falling Out Of Folder  No Spa Treatment List Included As Stated.
column47: Menu Did Not Have Accurate Descriptions. For Example  The Halibut Dish Arrived With Clams On It But This Was Not Stated On The Menu. It Did Not Have The Bacon On It Which Was Stated On The Menu.  I Have A Serious Allergy To Shellfish And This Potentially Could Have Caused Major Difficulties.
column61: Tables In Sitting Area Not Wiped  Dirty Dishes And Glasses Left Lying Around. However  The Lady Called Leanne Who Did My Facial Was Exceptional. She Was The Epitomy Of Professionalism Whilst Being Friendly And Welcoming  I Would Very Much Like To Go Back For Another Facial With Her.
column65: Leanne  In The Spa  As Mentioned Previously. Breakfast Staff On The Whole Were Very Pleasant  Helpful And Efficient.
column71: Our Experience At Dinner Was Somewhat Disappointing  Bearing In Mind We Have Stayed With You Before. On Arriving In The Lounge/Bar At 6.40 Pm The Staff Were Still Preparing For The Evening Service And After Waiting 10 Minutes My Husband Had To Go Up To The Bar To Order Drinks. The Service Felt Rushed And Not What We Expected From A Hotel Of The Feversham's Calibre. We Also Had An Issue When I Ordered A Glass Of Rose And On Ordering A 2Nd Glass A Different Wine Was Served And The Waiter Was Unable To Understand What The Issue Was  Due To A Language Difficulty. We Gave Up Trying To Explain It In The End. Also  My Husband's Halibut Arrived 'Black'  Which Wasn't Specified On The Menu. There Were Numerous Other 'Niggles' Which Would Appear Petty To Itemise  But The Whole Experience Left Us Feeling Disgruntled And Disappointed And Not All All As If We Had Experienced Fine Dining.

column15: Other: We Could Bring Our Dogs
column36: Did Not Use Internet So Can Not Comment. The Tv Was Not Working So We Had To Wait Until Day 2 For Maintenance Man To Connect
column47: The Service Is Slow And The Waiting Staff Do No Seem To Be 'On The Ball' Ie: If They Brought Fresh Tea To The Table They Left The Empty Pots On The Table And Returned To Kitchen Empty Handed Which Will Also Increase Their Workload
column65: Housekeeper Who Gave Us 'Older Towels' For Dogs When Wet And Concierge
column70: On Our Second Evening We Waited For Many Minutes To Be Asked If We Wanted Anything Whilst Sat In The Bar  Eventually My Husband Got Up And Went To The Bar To Order Drinks. You Are Missing Sales Opportunities...............It Seemed To Me That The Restaurant Bar Team Lacked Sparkle/Leadership  Motivation
column72: It Is Difficult In Your Industry As Guests Want The Heating On Full Because They Are Not Paying. Things You Can Control Are Recycling Maximisation  Reduced Towel Washing Which Most Hotels Now Do

column22: Didn't Receive E-Mail Confirmation Till I Phoned And Asked For It Several Days After Making Booking
column36: Room 19... No Hot Water On Two Separate Occasions  Had To Ask For Refill Of Bathroom Products No Intenet  And Dvd Didn't Work And Tv Needs Retuning/ Moved Due To Water Prob. Room 25.. This Room Had An Unpleasant Smell To It   Hard Water Not Removed From Inside Shower  Plug In Bath Needs Repairing
column47: Food Is Very Good.. Staff Very Friendly But Not Enough Attention Paid To Detail. My Cod Wasn't Cooked Through  Husband Ordered Port But It Wasn't Brought To Him Till After His Cheese Course Was Finished. Waited On 1St Night For Nearly An Hour After Reservation Till We Were Seated  All Small Things But These Could All Be Avoided With Just A Little Care And Attention.
column61: If I Had Booked A Spa Package Here I Would Have Been Disappointed  Robes Very Shabby  Not A Feel Good Wearing Those! Products In Changing Rooms Needed Filling Up  Mentioned It But Even After 4-5 Hours Not Done. Ice Machine Not Working  Wasn't Shown Around On Arrival Had To Ask A Member Of Staff.
column65: Iam A Great Welcoming Member Of Staff. Sue In Reservations? Helpful And Laura? Tall Young Woman In Dining Room All Went The Extra Mile. You Have Very Friendly Staff But I Feel That Someone Needs To Check The Finer Details In Your Hotel. Some Rooms I Feel Are Shabby And Need Looking At.
column70: Feversham Arms Looks An Amazing Place To Stay But As A Guest I Can't Stress Enough How The Little Attention To Detail Are So Important. I Don't Want To Go Away To What I Consider A High End Hotel (Your Accommodation Prices Vouch For That) And Have To Keep Nit Picking About The Small Stuff  It Is Exhausting And Frustrating.
column71: It Would Be Really Nice For You To Address Some Of These Matters Because Your Hotel Is Beautiful And Is Let Down By This. Do You Really Want Your Guests Discussing The Small Stuff Or Would You Rather We Had An Amazing Time And Came Back? I Am Sure Plenty Of People Do But I Would Of Liked To Have Been One Of Them Which I Don't Think I Will Be.

column36: It Was Tired.  The Bed Base Was Covered In Marks From Shoes.  It Either Needs A Fresh Valance Each Time Or A Different Bed Base That Allows Feet To Go Underneath Without Scraping The Cover. The Bathroom Floor Was Stained Around The Toilet Basin And By The Door.  The Bath Was Too Small For Two.
column47: The Staff All Appeared Very New To The Job And Were Very Matter Of Fact.  They Plonked The Food Down.  The Forgot Elements Of Food.  They Were Not Observing The Stage Of The Meal That We Were At.  We Had To Ask A Number Of Times For Them To Remove The Empty Glasses That Had Been Brought Through From The Bar. We Struggled To Understand What They Were Saying.  In The Bar We Asked For An Armagnac Brandy And The Barman Had No Idea What We Meant.  He Asked A Colleague And Eventually Brought Back A Bottle.  He Then Grabbed Two Whiskey Tumblers And Asked If We Wanted The Drink Over Ice.....
column61: The Spa Was Tired.  The Staff Weren't Really Interested.  They Were Just Doing Their Hours.
column65: The Receptionist At The Spa Was Very Professional And Made Us Very Welcome.  The Barman  Waiter And The Person That Delivered The Breakfast To Our Room All Lacked Training.
column70: Better Staff Training.  Flowers In The Room.
column71: We Were Told That The Pool Was Open From 7Am.  It Wasn't Open By 9.45Am When We Left.

column47: Dining Room Staff Were Overstretched And Under Trained
column65: All On Front Of House And The Cheese Man In The Restaurant

column22: I Wasn't Made Aware Of The Deals Available And Would Have Received Poor Value For Money If I Had Not Asked About The Deals.   The Lady I Spoke To Wasn't At All Helpful In Maximising What I Could Get For The Vouchers.  Having Checked The Website Before I Called I Was However Able To Get A Good Deal.
column26: We Had An Excellent Two Day Break.   The Restaurant Service Could Have Been Better........Food Was Only Lukewarm By The Time It Arrived At The Table.
column31: Someone Came Immediately To Help With The Bags  Which Was Much Appreciated.
column36: Room 16: Lovely Room With Fireplace  Marred By The Old Rug  Which Was A Bit Of A Trip Hazard.
column47: Waiter Was Poor......More Interested In Chatting Than Getting On With The Job.
column65: On Our Second Morning  Rosie  Who Served Breakfast Was Excellent And Actually Cleared Away Used Plates And Our Food Was Hot.......Much Better Than The Day Before.
column72: There Was Really No Need To Keep Changing The Towels......We Were Only There Two Nights.

column47: Was Made To Feel Very Unwelcome As We Were Placed In A Corner With Spotlights Which Made Us Very Hot Especially During This Heat Wave. Having Informed The Staff  They Suggested The Whole Restaurant Was Fully Booked So We Could Not Be Moved (Although Only 3 Tables Were Full Due To Having Dinner Early). Then A Suggestion Was Made About Finding A Fan  When One Was Found It Didn't Work  After That They Suggested Room Service. We Eventually Moved To Another Table Which I Didn't See Why We Weren't Moved There In The First Place As It Didn't Seem To Cause Any Problems. This Made Us Feel Very Unwelcomed As Your Restaurant Manager Did Not Attempt To Accommodate Us Fully And He Didn't Even Come Over To Explain The Situation Himself. When Taking Our Order He Was Also Very Abrupt And Quite Rude. We Therefore Cancelled Our Next Nights Dinner  Even Though We Had Booked Dbb.

column26: I Wrote To Your Hotel Manager Days Ago And A I Got Was This Email Asking For My Thoughts!!
column70: Respond To Complaints - Or Even Acknowledge Them!
column71: Trip-Advisr For You I'm Afraid - You Had Your Chance To Contact Me But Couldn't Be Bothered.
